I only gave this place 3 stars because the food is a little over-priced when compared to similar places. Also, the customer service was sub-par. Lastly, the building wasn't as clean as it should have been.

The difference between Caprioti's is they use real beef...Pops, as good as i tastes is barley beef.  I saw an empty box of "philly meat" out back as i walked to my car and read the ingredient label..wow, please dont cheap out by using food starch added meat products and claim it's better than Caps...Shame on you.

Best cheesesteak I've ever had outside of philly. So many places all over the country make steak sandwiches and call them philly cheesesteaks and it's usually a disappointment. Not at pop's. Real philly cheesesteaks in vegas!

Being from Philadelphia at one point I love this place but tonight 1 a.m. in the morning and in a vacation what a nightmare trying to deal with the fat guy and Chris trying to order a hoagie with oil and state it wasn't cooked 3 hours go out of a container and put on the grill again do yourselves a favor do not go there late at night they have no clue what you're doing and you're only there then work the late hours a complete sham
The best philly sandwich this side of Philly and maybe better than philly. Off the beaten path but worth the drive. I live far south of the valley but anytime I'm out near it I go.

In Vegas for most of May working at the House of Blues.
One of my buddies was jonesing for a philly cheesesteak.
All ingredients are shipped from back east, the rolls are perfect!
Excellent cheesesteaks, Steve was the grill master du jour, nice job!
They even have Tastee Cakes!

3.5 stars to be exact.  I just went to Geno's and Pat's in Philly the 1st week of Sept.  While the steak is a lot more chopped up here I would say it was pretty comparable.  The bread is really what you come here for I think cuz I guess you could make a pretty fair attempt at making these at home.  Still good though.

If you want a philly style cheese steak for a reasonable price, Pop's is a good choice.  They even have Frank's sodas.  The cheesesteak comes in several varieties including wit whiz, american, provelone, and cheddar.  The steak is flavorful and grilled right before your eyes.  I would avoid the sides though, not only are they prepackaged items like zucchini sticks, mozzerella sticks, mushrooms, etc, but they are all fried in the same oil.  They did not look good.
Still the sandwich is one of the better philly cheesesteaks in Las Vegas so give it a try.

I am fanatical about cheesesteaks. Some friends and I used to road trip from VA to 9th and Passyunk in Philly to put Pat's and Geno's head to head. (Pat's wins that battle, by the way.)

Anyhow, POP's is even more fanatical about cheesesteak. Look at their website and the detailed manifesto explaining why they use Liberty Steaks, Amarosa Bakery rolls and other carefully sourced and authentic ingredients.

It shows in the finished product, a Pat's style sandwich with ribeye chopped on the grill. I order mine wit extra onions (caramelized to a beautiful brown) and Cheez Whiz. I recommend you do the same. Can't go wrong with the classics.

This is a true Philly style experience with a walk up counter, metal tables on a patio, and a mural of Ben Franklin on the wall, and it's open 24/7. It's a half hour drive for me but well worth it. Best cheesesteak in Vegas, easily.

I tried Pop's because I love me some good cheesesteak, and they offered a 2-for-1 coupon on their site, so I couldn't resist.

This place is tiny with minimal covered outdoor seating. There's a walk-up window where you order and pay for your food. The service is nothing special; not horrible but not the greatest, either. The guy that took our order was also the cook, and he makes the cheesesteaks right in front of you.

Both, my husband and I, decided on the #2 Cheese Whiz Steak  w/grilled onions (the onions don't automatically come with, so be sure to ask for them), and an order of fried okra and onion rings. 

Cheesesteaks: The bread was nice and soft and held up well to the decent amount of filling. The meat, on the other hand, was kind of dry and lacking in flavor - it needed some seasoning. 

Fried okra and onion rings: They were both perfectly fried and not too greasy, but they're the frozen stuff that you get at the store.

All in all, not a bad place, but I've had better.

Lets start from the beginning...its on a busy street corner. There isn't a drive thru like you would think. Small parking lot. It's noisy, kinda dirty, more expensive than I thought. So, just like the 2-star rating says, "Meh, I've experienced better".

If you want a big sandwich for $12 and it's late...Pop's might fit the bill. For the money I'd rather go to Roberto's.

I'd read about Pop's in LV Weekly awhile ago and when the Groupon for this place popped up, we seized the opportunity and ventured over to Decatur to check it out.  I was surprised to discover it was an outdoor establishment with no indoor seating, and wasn't sure what to expect since the place doesn't look like much at first glance. 

But looks can be deceiving, and I was VERY impressed with the food -- everything is made to order, so even though we sat outside in the 60 degree evening to eat our phillies at one of the tables, the food was piping hot.  I liked that they had a few options for cheese since I'm not a cheese whiz fan, so I got provolone instead with peppers and onions and it was delish.  My boyfriend got the same and we shared the crunchy fried green beans with marinara sauce, which were very good.  Portions were pretty big so you definitely get a lot of food for your money.  I'd definitely go here again!

first of all throwing down Steakems on a grill isn't a cheese steak.  charging 11.99 is bullshit too.  I have had  pats, genos,  world famous out of Burbank and a ton of cheese steaks in new England.  the cheese steak at domingos isn't as good as this place's cheesesteak.  but if you have had a domingo cheesesteak that isn't saying anything.  POPS YOU SUCK.

really how much less would you make on your 12 dollar shitty sammich if you used real shaved beef not frozen industrial steakem meat and the proper amount of cheese?  a dollar less maybe 50 cents? 

there is no way I would ever eat here again, so I guess getting 17 bucks out of me for fries a sandwhich and a dr pepeer was a good idea. and I guess if you really want cheese on your CHEESE STEAK  you better get the double order which would be the regular amount of cheese ANYWHERE ELSE THAT CLAIMED TO MAKE CHEESE STEAKS IN THE WORLD, WHICH THESE ARE NOT.  there are shitty imitation made with some steakem type material.  oh I said that already.

I can only imagine the lady who gave it 5 stars was paid for that review or is so used to having awful things in her mouth this seemed better than ...well you can fiqure out where I was going.

the fries were okay.  not worth an extra star though.


SHITTY AWFUL Expensive and disappointing.
Awesome good food! They know how to make some excellent cheese steaks! Service was fast and prices were decent. MmMmm don't forget about the WHIZ WHEELS!
Always loved this place , since before it was pop's.  Great Phillies but I prefer their bbq pork , and chicken. Just repeat several times what you want. They don't always hear substitutes, add ons..

This is one of our favorite places. The grill dudes are always awesome, I can get my out of towner and the boyfriend can get his classic. Yummy. Also they have fried okra! FTW!  I recommend this place to everyone looking for a good philly.

This has been my go to cheesesteak place for many years. Being from the Philly area, this has been one of the best choices for cheesesteaks, no matter how far I have to drive to get it. They're much better if you can eat there, but tables are outside and weather doesn't always cooperate. Prices have gone up but its worth it. Go on your birthday for a free tastycake...yum! I like to order my cheesesteak with extra cheese. Staff is pleasant.

Well I went back there a few weeks ago and tried their breakfast Philly. It was awesome! 
I believe it is the cook who makes it wort overpaying for a philly. The cook- it was a young man who works am on the weekends mostly- that mead this experience worth its weight in gold.

I had high hopes for this place, because it looks like the perfect hole in the wall you've yet to discover. Cheesy side murals, dim lighting, hand painted signs, all the makings for a secret delicious spot. 
I ordered the chicken Philly with bell peppers, provolone, and mushroom. It was very hot and cheesy, which was a plus! But almost too hot....I had to pause in between bites or else risk third degree burns. Overall it was kind of tasteless. And dry. The fries were no good, we ate a couple and tossed the rest. That's pretty bad considering I love fries so much that my standards are pretty low. They tasted like fries you would get at the public pool snack stand when you were a kid. 
Overall I would say this is fine if you're hungry and in the area....but definitely would not make a special trip for it. Most likely I will not be back again.

Philly steaks only come 2nd to bbq in terms of my favorite food. With that being said, this is one of my top 5 favorite places to eat when I'm home. Genuine cheesesteaks, which you can get with Whiz, provolone or American (go for the Whiz). They also have an awesome BBQ pork grinder with a great sauce. And its 24 hours, which is a HUGE plus.

Upon recommendation from a very good buddy, I stopped by and got a Philly Steak with provolone / onions / peppers.  OMG, it was fantastic!  It brought back great memories of my trips to Philly.  There was plenty of meat, just the right mixture of other ingredients, and the roll was perfect.

There is no "ambiance" to this place ... which gives it it's own "ambiance" (if you get my drift).  I probably wouldn't frequent this place at night, but it's well worth a trip if you're in Vegas and have a car.
Had the Bell Pepper Philly with onions and provolone.  Wasn't bad at all for $10.80.
Benn coming here since the 90's & never have had a bad sub. For steaks, I order a #4, always great. For breakfast, you can't beat their bacon & egg hoagie. Sooooooooo good!!!

I didn't know there was so many different  cheeses to put on my Philly cheese steaks, he asked me what kind of cheese I wanted I was lost I said "Philly cheese" lol but on the real I love this place.


 the corner location scares me with so much speeding traffic i always think about a car or truck crashing into people trying to enjoy this place be safe...
I had the #34 chili cheese steak sandwich mmmmm most delicious wit sweet potato fries..I sure will b coming back when I stay out here in Vegas. .. going to try out the whole menu..lol

I'm not big on philly cheesesteaks but we decided to go one day after we were done clubbing. One of my friends recommended POP'S since it was kinda close to us and its open 24 hrs. I  I ordered mine with provolone, green peppers, onions, and jalapenos...and a side of fries and ranch.  It was really good! I crave them all the time.

My boyfriend and I went out to grab a philly at 2am a few weeks ago, and it was pretty good. The sandwiches were a little expensive, at least in my opinion, but they were full of meat and toppings, so I can't complain too much. As for flavor, well, to be honest, I've had much better. These weren't  bad, just not that great. Plus, they have no restroom, which is really weird for a food place. It's also not the cleanest place around, but I suppose that's part of it's seedy tasty charm. :P
 We'll probably be back at some point, simply because it's open so late, unless we find something better.

The workers here are jerks, and I'm obviously not expecting high class service coming from a place like this, but dang, a customer is still a customer. Even after the guy taking my order made me repeat my plain Philly steak again, he still mixed up the orders and put the wrong cheese on and toppings. I said I wanted an original philly steak with everyhing, he said "whats everything?" umm, what normal philly steaks have? Sandwich was super soggy and not enjoyable.
I had one of my favorite sandwiches last night... Steak with swiss cheese and bacon.. Fries with cheez whiz ... just wanted I wanted...

Good bread, good meat and they are willing to do the sauteed onions without peppers if you want.  The only downside is that there really is not much to look at other than traffic while you are eating your food.

I just want to say if you are mexican and you want a philly cheesesteak do not go to "pops philly steak" on Decatur and Oakey. I never had a problem with them until my fiance paid with her debit card while the old man that works there asked for her I.D. as she showed it to him to verify the name on the debit card he tells her "man you people always have long names". I asked him what the hell does that mean as he walked away acting like he couldn't hear me. Racism should not be tolerated at all. I will never go back to this place ever again...

Great place! It's an order window but looks huge on the outside as I expected to sit in. You can sit out on the large patio which made it great to bring my little dog. I only eat seafood so wanted the fish philly but they were out. We arrived just short of midnight. Decided on the tuna but there was only enough for one of us so me and the wife had to share. Ok so with all these hiccups why the 5 stars? I explained that I wanted my tuna sub like the philly sandwiches. They had never done it before and was very confused. Then out of nowhere I got the "what the heck" and he went for it. He made it just for me and I couldn't have been happier. It came out amazing!!!! Get there earlier if you want the less popular foods (seafood).

#32 Peppers & Mushroom Cheese Steak is grilled sliced beef with grilled peppers, onions, mushrooms, and your choice of cheese. This is the best cheesesteak I have ever had! I've had them in Philadelphia and, I have to say, POP'S is so much better. The meat is to die for! It is cooked to perfection - juicy and full of flavor. The vegetables are cooked with the meat so the uber beef flavor envelops the vegetables like a warm blanket. Just like Pat's, they served Cheez Whiz. If you're not a fan, try it on the side first. The provolone cheese melts to a gooey goodness and covers every bit. The Amoroso bread is wonderful. It has a sturdy crust on the outside, light and airy on the inside. It has a subtle french/sourdough taste to it which works great with the steak. Thumbs up, way up!
Delicious Philly steaks. Made fresh. Best sauce for sweet potato fries.
Hands down the best Philly steaks we've had in Vegas so far. After a night of drinking they're even better. Definite comfort food to the max.
So so good! Great service, outdoor seating, fresh ingredients! The pride José has in Pop's is inspiring!
I finally got a chance to try Pop's after living here for the past two years and I must say I was not disappointed. Tender meat, creamy cheese wiz, crisp veggies and fresh bread = yummy!

This place is open 24 hours. The menu is pretty big so there are plenty of options. We got 2 cheesesteaks, one order of fries and two drinks. There bill came to $27... Which may seem a bit steep for a roadside stand. But the food was good. Although next time I think I'll skip the fries. They were nothing special.

24hrs... and great quality!!!!!!!!
Since there is enough said about the cheesesteaks, thought I would add something different.
Pop's has the best breakfast sandwich!! Steak, Eggs, Cheese!! I love it and it has saved me from the hangover monster on more than a few mornings!
Also, the turkey sandwich is top flight! The bread is amazing, and makes sense that they bring it in from back East.
I don't eat "fast food" and I consider Pop's to be anything but typical fast food, the higher quality is obvious, and I don't mind paying for it.
Highly recommended!

Okay, let me just preface something, I'm from the suburbs of Philly.  This place makes a good eff'n cheesesteak!  When we moved to Vegas, I knew there were gonna be some things I would not be able to get out here like Utz Potato Chips, Kunzler Ham, etc.  I thought for sure the cheesesteak would be one of them until we found Pop's.  Both Charles K.'s and Reggie M.'s testimonials are 100% true and to back it up http://www.popscheesesteaks.com/

The worst thing about this place, it's not open Sunday.

Still the best Philly Cheese Steak without having to purchase a plane ticket.

18 years in this town and I have not found anyone more authentic then Pops for cheese steaks.  Yes there are many places that claim they have a philly, but no one really has a philly other the in philly, however pops comes the closest to what I remember after living in Philly for many years.

It is close enough to make you want to go back to philly.  This place is good, they have a variety of cheeses you can put on and are even creative with some toppings.  

Open 24/7 you cannot beat that.  One of the best an worth the drive to that side of town.  I will post a picture so you can drool....

I really don't like cheese steaks in general, but this little hole in the wall (or A-frame off the strip) had unusually good food. I had a 1/2 steak CS with peppers, swiss cheese, onions and mushrooms. It was all very tasty, tasted pretty fresh and was made to order. The service was very friendly. Be sure to ask for the hot sauce!

Definitely my favorite place to go for a cheese steak. Will drive the distance to go here! Be conscious that its is all outdoors so keep weather in mind, but absolutely worth it. Yeah, its pricey but the flavors are more than enough to satisfy that craving.They make the food right in front of you and they do it quickly. Their menu expands past  Philly cheese steaks and fries, I really love their Italian sub its phenomenal!!!!! And dont forget to order the sweet potato fries, they are served with an apple cinamon sauce that makes them over the top!
Not good . Jalapeño poppers were not what I was expecting . Tasted like they didn't wash them right . Just not appetizing. Cheesesteak not as tasty as expecting either .
The Menu is vast and clogged with cholestrol filling items. It was right up my alley. Love that its open 24 hrs. Wish the drive thru was open though.

I went on Saturday and got the Mushroom and cheese philly. It tasted great with melted provolone cheese melting through the meat. I am really happy it's opened 24 hours so if you are in the mood for something other than fast food late at night this is a place to stop by, it's located across from Arizona Charlie's on the West of Vegas.

I use to come here all the time when I lived in this area but haven't been back in awhile. Awesomely, they've expanded their menu and add fried zucchini, fried mushrooms, salad options, sweet potato fries and other cool side dishes they never had before! I'll have to try them with another visit soon.  
This time I got chicken, provolone, onions and mushrooms. Sad to say, it lacked any flavor at all. Apparently the original owners had sold it and that could explain the change in quality. But still, I have to go back and try the yummy looking options they've added.
They are also a walk up window and only have a few outdoor stools and tables to dine at, so be sure to be dressed accordingly with the weather if you decided to stay and eat there.

Okay, the friends ravvvved about this place... and um, it was not up to par. 

Apparently, it was a no-no to go on a Thursday night. 

The Best "Grill Master" works on Friday and Saturday Night...

So, if you go, go one one of those days... 

I must say though, the fried okra was awesome!

As someone from the Philly area, driving by had me pretty excited. Pop's looks like Pat's! However, I got a cheesteak, with whiz, onions, and peppers- but they forgot the flavor.  Everything about it was bland.  I couldn't differentiate between the meat and the onions. It was weird. And the bread was awful- it was soft and did not taste like an Amoroso. Looks were most definitely deceiving. That said, the patio is great! And so were the sweet potato fries.

Pop's Philly Steaks They wont let me post on their wall any more. Great place if you want to be give a sandwich you didn't order (never ate before in your life) and then when you take it to the window to tell them they gave you the wrong order. they say "NO thats what you ordered and walk away" Gret place if your in the mood for food roulette.
There are only a few things that I absolutely crave & Pops is one of them. A #2 (philly with cheese wiz w/sweet peppers is my all-time go to! Everything you want when you think philly cheese steak.

Awesome food! Highly recommended I've had a few of there sandwiches and I can say I've never been disappointed always satisfied and there zucchini fries are bomb and the banana fosters bits are delicious.
this was the most bland, tasteless philly I have ever had.  Soggy, nasty bell peppers. maybe weekends are fine, but don't do it on a week night !

I've been coming here for years and despite the amazing food and service, I haven't had a chance to write a review, so here's the amazingness in a nutshell: 

Pop's may look like it's in the wrong area, but what it lacks in appearance, it more than makes up for with quality and service. The food is absolutely ADDICTING, service is quick and friendly, and they've never ever gotten my order incorrect! 

I recommend this place to people all the time and the verdict is always the same: a new favorite. 

On another note, this place is probably the only decent 24 hour fast food joint in all of Vegas.

Some background: I have lived in and around Philly for 29 years, and just moved to Las Vegas in July. I used to live down Passyunk from Pat's and Geno's, and for the last 4 years I lived near the Dalessandro's (the real king of Philly steaks). Soooo I think I am fairly qualified to give this review.

After finding out that Pop's was a short drive from my office, I decided to head down there to devour thousands of delicious calories in one sitting. I wish I saved those calories for something better. What a disappointment!! 

I asked for my go-to, a cheesesteak hoagie (typically it's steak, cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion). He told me mayo was included, and I told him no mayo please. After waiting 5 minutes for my steak, I get it in a paper bowl thing with a fork stuck on top. Never saw that before... Sat down, pulled apart my steak to put ketchup in there, and I realized the thing is slathered in mayo. NASTY. Brought my steak back to the counter, told the woman at the register about the mistake, and they made me another. I had to get this to go since I needed to be back at work. Back at my office, I take a bite of my steak and there is some kind of vinegar flavoring in the hoagie. I don't know if the onions were cooked in it or if the guy thought this would be good or if was just suffering from temporary insanity.... Ugh. I ate it, but only because I paid $14 with a drink and chips. 

First, the prices were a little much for what you're getting. My cheesesteak hoagie was $10. I used to pay $8 at Dalessandro's. It's $6.50 at Dalessandro's for a plain steak and it's $8 at Pop's. The quality was a 2 star compared to Dalessandro's 5 star, so confused on the mark up of price. Maybe because the rolls are shipped from Amaroso's? 

If you've never had a Philly steak, I can see why you might like these. If you have experienced the best of the best, you will walk away disappointed. Between the price, flavor, and authenticity, I won't be returning.

I think this maybe one of the best Philly cheesesteaks  I've had! Loved the sweet potato fries. Haven't been here in years, how could I forget?! The sandwich will easily feed two - it's a little pricey, but it's worth it

We waited in the "Order Line" for about 20 minutes (somewhat long line) just for Italian Ice, the man behind the grill told me to just go to the register so I proceeded over there and waited behind the couple who was orginally in front of me in the first place. I was fine with the waiting until the man at the register automatically started ringing up the woman behind me without even acknowledging me or asking for my order. Another five or so minutes passed then the woman next to me apologized for them taking her before me and even asked if I could just get an Italian Ice to which the guy at the grill gave an annoyed look and said the other guy would get it. I waited another 5 minutes of nothing with no line besides the woman who was orginally behind me before deciding to just leave. The man ran out the back door to say he'd take my order when we were already across the street getting into the car. Never have had their food but for that alone i will NEVER EVER be back nor recommend it to anyone. I wish I could give this 0 stars for that alone.

I love their sandwiches...really fresh and hot :)
for some reason..I always go there after work out..maybe I feel like it's healthy and low calories or something..
I've never heard bad thing about this place and never complained of this sandwich place!
I love their mushroom + jalapeno sandwich! they have some good sweet potato fries too!!
really fast but not so a instant food! have to try this place!!the best steak sandwich place ever!!

Philly cheese steak sandwiches in Vegas baby! Located on the southeast corner of Decatur and Alta, you can do some serious people watching here. No indoor dining area and no drive through, but yet somehow this place it getting a four star rating from GA. 

I ordered the #3, Steak and American cheese. 'Merica! Topped with grilled onions for good measure. It got better with every bite. Juicier and juicier with melted cheese all the way to the end. The French fries were hot and crispy. Next time I'll try the Cheese Whiz fries like JR got. They looked they could have been named after some crazy 80's band. They looked "Totally Cheezy Awesome." They have a sign that says they welcome you watching your food being prepared. So I did. It was kind of cool. They serve breakfast sandwiches too. Can't wait to try one.

To all the people leaving bad reviews saying these are not real cheese steaks they are crazy. The meat is cooked right in front of you so how can you say it's not? Every time I go they pull out a slab a raw meat off wax paper not out of a croc pot. The bread and most of the other ingredients are shipped from Pennsylvania.   Born and raised in Philly these are not 100% but your also not in Philly,  your in vegas that being said these are the best your gonna find in vegas.
Loved it! Some of the best philly steaks I've tried. Everything is made in front of you so its fresh..you have to eat outside which is a little inconvenient since its hot out but still great place!!
Honestly, better then cheesesteaks in philly. And I am from the east coast and have been to Gino's and Pat's. The ONLY place to get a cheesesteak in Vegas is here and its open 24 hours too.

Well we got the # 4 Philly Cheese Steak with provolone, the #8 Philly Cheese Steak with Mushrooms and provolone, and an order of fries. The cheese steaks were fresh and delicious.  Good price and quick service.

I like the feel of this place and the sandwiches are big and stuffing. 

I've tried the Philly steak (w/ onions, peppers, whiz), BBQ pork hoagie, Italian sausage sub. Out of the apps I've gotten sweet potato fries,fried zucchini and the fried green beans. 

All have been really good, but I love fried green beans so that hits this happy spot for me with sharing a Philly Whiz cheese steak.
Very curious to try the bananas foster, fried okra and whiz wheels.

Open late so a plus for night owls like us. Since it's made piping hot to order, it's still nice and warm when we get home. You go to any other fast food and that crap is cold when we get home- another 10-15 minute drive on the FWY. MMM... night owls deserve something warm in the belly too.

awesome philly cheese steak, I am from the east coast mid Atlantic area and Pop's has it on lock down for cheese steaks. it's well worth the trip to try this place out. Also they have tasty cakes... Another mid Atlantic staple for a sweet. thanks Pop's for being out West
The whiz!!!  lol the best late nite munchie food on the Westside!  Love it!

always loved this spot even under different names - grillmen are friendly and steaks are tasty...

they go to the trouble of ordering amoroso bread in from philly giving the steaks that true philly feel.

big ups, mad love. this is my fav cheesesteak on this side of the country.

I am a Jersey girl so for me to say this is an actual Philly cheesesteak you must know it's true. They use the Amoroso rolls the real Philly steak meat and make it exactly like it tasted back home. I would go here every day if possible. Highly recommended

I've been coming to Pop's since before it was Pop's. Haven't been here in a couple years now. Was a little disappointed steak was no longer fresh but Frozen, made for a dry sandwich. Fries are still great people there extra friendly business seems good the lunch line was four or five people. Still a good sandwich just not the great one I remember comma but what is as good as it used to be really? Also got a free Tasty Cake for my birthday today!!

This is another hole-in-the-wall place that locals love to frequent. I'll have to say, their cheese steaks were pretty solid. We ordered cheese steaks with cheese whiz and onions. The sandwich was very tasty and had a good meat to cheese to bread ratio. Slightly greasy, but in a good way. You may think that prices are a bit high for a sandwich, but their portions are very generous. When I lived in Las Vegas, my only gripe with this place was that it was kind of out of the way if I was craving a good cheese steak.

I  had been wanting to try Pop's for the longest time.  And every time I drive by the colorful stand, I think to myself "Why on God's green earth have I not been there yet?".  Well, all this anticipation contributed to the big let down.  

I love anything authentic.  And supposedly all of the ingredients (rolls, cheese, meat) are flown in directly from Philly itself. I ordered the provolone mushroom cheesesteak, and it was just OK.  Maybe I needed to order the cheese whiz to make it more authentic, but I just can't bring myself to eat something that artificially bright yellow. 

The roll was definitely piled high with the tender meat.  I only ate half because it was so filling.  But it wasn't as seasoned or flavorful as I was expecting it to be.  The mushrooms added some flavor, but that was it.  Perhaps I am just not a phillycheesesteak type of girl. 

There were 2 people ahead of me in line, so there was a bit of a wait. I am just grateful I went in the spring and not in the middle of summer.  I doubt i will have any cheesesteak cravings any time soon, but it is comforting to know that if I do have one, they are open 24 hours.

*Yelp 100 Challenge: Review 26/100*

Great quick stop for a Philly Cheese Steak, especially if you are up late or getting off work in the early hours of the morning (as my fellow gravies do). The fries are good, the Phillys are excellent, and the cook is always tip worthy.

If you are planning to eat "in" then wear a nice thick jacket in the winter as the seating is all patio.

I've been in Vegas for almost two years, and though I've driven by here a few times, I never stopped until tonight. Jet me tell you, I'm a bit disappointed in myself, because this place is delicious, and I just cheated myself out of two years of fantastic sandwiches!
The number 32 with onions and American cheese is savory and delicious, and I can't wait to visit again soon!

I really hate to leave a bad review for this place. I've been going her for as long as I can remember. Since it changed from Philly Steakout to Pop's. I absolutely love their sandwiches and never really had bad service or a complaint for that matter.

I was craving a Philly Cheese Steak last night, but couldn't get one until my check hit. So I really really really wanted a Philly Cheese Steak tonight. 

It was a bit chilly out and there was a couple on the side, I was told they already ordered. So I placed my order a #32 and a #6 both with bacon. The previous two times prior they were pretty sparse with the meat and bacon compared to what I'm used to, I figured it was just the Grill Master. This time was no different, he put a lot of onions for one sandwich and barely any for the other, I didn't say anything because I don't like to complain. He made my sandwiches, then cut them wrapped them and put them aside. I figured he was waiting for the cashier to come ring me up, so I patiently waited. He began assisting the couple that had already ordered. (It appeared they were waiting for wings) I figured it would be just a minute or two and I would get my food, however that was not the case. I ended up waiting for over 7 minutes, the couples card declined 3 times. I decided I wasn't going to pay $25+ for two cold sandwiches that have been sitting there for about 10 minutes. 

Money is tight so I haven't been able to indulge as much as I would like and I was really looking forward to a Hot Philly Cheese Steak sandwich. I think the employees really dropped the ball this time. If I'm paying around $12 a sandwich I want it hot. If you're helping someone else, that's fine I'll wait. I want my food hot off the grill.

I want the old Grill Master back. The Philly was stuffed to the rim and there was bacon in every bite. I never once got cold food.

How do people think this is a real philly cheesesteak? The meat has NO FLAVOR, the mushrooms are clearly out of a can and taste gross and have no flavor at all. Its in a shady location but it does have a legacy behind it. Its cool that its open 24 hours but it tastes SO BAD so who cares?!. Tried the Italian ices and they tasted awful as well. Stay away from this place. Looks really dirty as well there are other places I would choose over this place for sure.

I came here at 3 in the morning after a long winning night in Vegas. And I wasn't done winning yet!

This is hands down the best cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly. The rolls were fresh, the steak was juicy and delicious and the cheese was near perfect. I paired this with cheese fries that disappeared in mere seconds. 

It's a drive off the strip but I highly, highly recommend it to anyone craving a real cheesesteak in Vegas.

Went here in January. Wasn't anything special and they were out of pastrami so I didn't get a sandwich. My hubby ordered a cheese-steak. It didn't appeal to me enough to beg a bite from him and I was really hungry.. I ended up ordering by phone from the Blue Nile restaurant (yummy Ethiopian food - great choice). I did have a few fries though. They were alright. Only went once and was not really impressed enough to try it again. There are far too many culinary delights in Vegas to waste time on the mediocre. You are not going to miss out if you skip this place for another random sandwich shop.

Best cheesesteak I've had, very good and nicely proportioned.  

It's been here since forever, so you know it is good if they are still around.  I usually order the cheese wiz with onions, even though I don't like onions, they are very sweet and tender.

They also have some of the best chili cheese fries I have had.  Give em a try and see if you agree.

Only bad thing is the fact that it is 100% outside, so if the super hot, crazy cold, windy, rainy, etc weather that we always seem to have, it's not a very good place for lunch or dinner.  But when the weather permits, have a philly!

I am not experienced as to what makes a good Philly cheesesteak.  About all the ones I have had are lacking flavor for me, so I have never been a fan.  But the ones here are pretty good.  

I would go here more if it wasn't in an area I loathe driving to, but that is probably a good thing as these are very bad for me.  This is another area of Vegas where I'm afraid to get out of my car.  The huge iron fences on the windows when you order from here says it all - this neighborhood is crap.

Don't kill me people but, I am not a fan of the cheese whiz on these sandwiches, as I think it completely ruins the flavor.  But I am a fan of provolone.

One thing I should mention is that they had soft pretzels on the menu when we were there last time.  My husband, who orders soft pretzels pretty much everywhere he goes wanted one, and was informed him they took these off the menu, because no one really orders pretzels at a cheesesteak place.  They went in back anyhow and dug one up for him and warmed it up with some of the cheese wiz on the side.  Very cool of them to do that.

The closest thing to a Philly cheesesteak available in Las Vegas! It's very hard to find authentic cheesesteaks here, this is the place to get them. They are delicious! They also carry Tastykake products which takes you back to Philly. And the cheese wiz fries, yum!!

we have been coming here for at least 12 years or more, and the cheesesteaks are always awesome. We come all the way from Henderson ( at least a 25 minute drive one way  just to eat here). Oooey, Gooey yummy ! very casual and simple eating area but we come for the food ! I think they are the best philly steaks in Vegas ! Give me that #2 with extra "Whiz" !!!!!! and the cheese fries, oh man, don't get me started... lol this is like my guilty pleasure! Of course ya cant eat here everyday, that would be like a heart attack waiting to happen, but once or twice a month is just right!!!! Love this place and sure wish they had a location in Henderson ! will keep coming back

The Three Cheese Chili is good and one of the most expensive sandwiches on the menu. $9.99. Other favorites like pastrami chili cheese fries and Hogies are good.

Plan on working out extra hard for at least 3 days after POPs. Other than that, sit back, relax, and rub your belly. This site is not Fat Free, and neither is POPs. Enjoy!

Ordered fried mushrooms and okra for myself and hot wings and fries for my husband. 

*- Okra was really good but the mushrooms was horrible! It tasted as if the mushrooms were over-due or something. I also couldn't help but notice that everything wasn't freshly prepared. Everything was frozen until ordered. 

-* husband likes the wings and fries. I didn't get a chance to try any because I was so disgusted with the mushrooms. Made me lose my appetite.

This is the closest thing to an authentic Philly cheese steak that I've tried.

I ordered the Cheese Whiz ($6.99) with grilled onions.  Lots of meat flavor with the grilled onions.  I think getting cheese is a must for these Philly steaks because without it, it would be very dry.  A little pricey but it is a big serving and could be hard to finish by yourself.  Also ordered french fries ($2).  They were the thick ones and they were okay, not great.

I came here expecting a hot and delicious Philly steak and received a chewy cold bread and cheese disaster. 

Cold cheese whiz. Nasty food and service.

and very over-priced!!!

Way over-rated.  My boyfriend and I got two sandwiches, one regular and one whiz.  The meat is too salty and doesn't taste like anything special.  I did enjoy the whiz which is the only sandwich I recommend.

Sandwiches were good fries are ok. The banana foster was really good the service was a little slow but not to bad they didn't ask if I wanted something to drink if you like eating outside in the hundred degree weather then it's worth going for a lunch but don't expect anything special

Okay well it's a friendly environment , open 24 hours and it has a lot of flies flying around. I don't suggest wearing a muscle shirt because I'm wearing a muscle shirt and it got into my bra which was gross so I gave my order to my dad and went to hide out in the car .

No lie I come from all the way from Carson, California just to eat at this place so it should say a lot already.. But if you happen to come visit Vegas it's a must try and if you are a resident there's no reason why you haven't came by. 
I got the philly steak drooling over here lol but the meat is to tender and the cheese is just melted so perfectly, good job big guy behind the grill :)

Placed a order for wings french fries and fried green beans . Got on route to my destination while enjoying my fried green beans which were up to par , crispy as preferred . Get to the chicken which i had half hot n half regular both were nice n fresh but were a tad on the salty side . While trying to enjoy my wings i go in to enjoy my nice fresh potatoes when i find 
Them to b  non existent in my bag . Very disappointing especially when i was CHARGED for something i did not receive not to mention who i believe to be the owner comes to the car and tells me my order is ready

I was actually really impressed with this place.  After going out you know you want something delicious and this is a great spot.  The food is amazing I usually get the Cheese Wiz because let's face it when getting a Philly the only cheese you should put on it is Cheese Wiz.  The Fried Okra was amazing!!!! I haven't had that good of Fried Okra since I lived in Texas.

This place is amazing. I just submitted a recommendation to Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives. The Philly cheese steaks are the best you'll ever get. I recently read their website and have a new appreciation for their craft. The Amoroso bread is made in Philly, flash frozen and shipped within hours to PoP's. It's unique in many ways including the water used has a mineral content not found in Vegas and its baked at a lower altitude. It's delicious! 
They take a ton of pride in their work and truly are the Pride of Philly.

Uhm... maybe I am slightly judgmental because I have been to Philly. I remember going to Pop's a few years ago, and thinking it was amazing. That was pre-Philly and pre-Philly Steakout.

The Steak:

Pop's is okay. I ordered the traditional with the whiz and onion. It was fresh. The bread was soft, but it wasn't anything to write home about. You can honestly buy meat from the butcher near the Meadows mall, and recreate something just as tasty yourself.

The Italian "ice":

A total miss. I adore real Italian ice, which was my main reason for stopping by. This tasted like a masked popsicle. Such a disappointment!

I would go back if I was in the area, but I'm sticking to Straight from Philly Steakout.
This is a "go-to-place"! You will find just the right food for your hunger. Tastee and lots of it!

It was late and my wife and I wanted cheesesteaks and since pop's was open we deicided to try this place out. It is small and all outdoor seating but since it was a nice night it was not an issue. The food we ordered was not bad considering it was pre-cooked and just waiting to be used. It was kinda a turn off but since it tasted awesome, we overlooked that part. The portion they gave us was HUGE we could of easily split one but since I can put food away I was not complaining. Also the fried banana foster was not good so stay away unless you just want to try it

Las Vegas hidden gem! Pop's is a mom and pop sandwich shop that serves top notch Philly cheese steaks and a plethora of other delicious grilled and fried foods. I recommend the bbq pork sandwich and fried zucchini. I don't live on that side of town, but whenever I am in the neighborhood I try to stop there. They are open 24 hours so stop by any time.

I ordered a beef and cheese sandwich, which was forgettable. It was beefy, but flavorless. Considering that I have spent time in the East Coast, this in no way resembles hot sandwiches out there. I also found it to be on the expensive side. Their sides look interesting, but will sample them only if I'm in the area, which is right off the Meadows Mall and the 95.
This place is amazing - the food always very good and the staff is always friendly- Never would look for a cheese steak elsewhere.
Pops hits the spot when you are craving greasy food at midnight.  Chili cheese fries are yummy!  Hit up this spot if you are in vegas!  Will def come again.  :)

This place is amazing. As a second generation of Native from Sin City we have been eating here since what seems like forever. 

Their cheesteaks are awesome! Meat, peppers, cheese etc are all artery clogging awesomeness! Only thing keeping this OG eatery from getting 5 stars is it is missing that fresh bread you expect from cheeseteaks on the east coast.

Several opther maddening options on the menu as well...the pastrami chilli cheese fries will just haunt you in your sleep....that good.

Love this place and will keep going back til I die. Hope fully not from an artery clogged heart attack.

This is the closest thing I've found to my favorite steak n cheese shop back home in Boston. The rolls are soft, steak is on point and they'll load it up with mushrooms and provolone for ya. Delicious. 

Tip: stay away from the sides. Everything is frozen, then dropped into a fryer. Not yummy.
The Cheesesteak is the best in Vegas.  Outdoor seating only.  Go when the weather is nice.

I've been wanting to try this place for some time.  I was hoping for a truly legendary cheese steak experience.  Unfortunately I was more than a bit disappointed with flavor.  There are many more places to get a great cheese steak in the valley, and unless I'm in the area, I don't see a need to come back here.

I got the Bacon and Swiss Cheese steak.  Everything should be better with bacon, right?  Not in this case, the bacon didn't add much flavor, and the swiss was definitely a mistake.  A good cheese steak always comes with whiz.  Provolone is acceptable but if you really want the flavor, the whiz is where it's at.  The steak itself was sliced perfectly and was melt in your mouth, except it lacked a flavor.  The sandwiches were nice sized for what you pay, but overall for someone who is just a Philly Steak place, it was a bit of a letdown.  

They have a lot of sides, and I can't comment on their flavors.  If you find yourself in the northern part of the west side, this place will more than meet your need for cheese steak at all hours of the night.

They do have a nice seating area, and they have misters for the heat.

The best Philly I've ever had and I am not a huge red meat fan.  The sandwiches are huge my 2 teenage boys have a hard time finishing these so who cares if they're a bit pricey.
Dang now I'm craving one!
Yum. I like mine wit onions and whiz. Better than Tat's in Seattle which is a huge compliment.

The only authentic philly cheesesteak place in Vegas, simply because they have CheezWiz. Although the taste is sketchy sometimes, it's worth going out of your way for... and since it's DEAD CENTER WEST it's not really close to anything.

I think it's be awesome (and cheaper) for them to use nacho cheese instead of cheez wiz. It's probably taste better too since it has a kick.

Big Sloppy sandwiches just like I like them!

Great place.  Will definitely be going back. Wrote a blog about it.  Check it out below

http://delectablehideaway.blogspot.com/2016/05/pops-philly-steaks.html?spref=tw&m=1

Well, I tried.

I've lived in the Philadelphia area my entire life. I've eaten cheesesteaks at several different places, so I like to think I know what I'm talking about. I was looking forward to trying Pops, as many people have said they're the most authentic in the city.

Well, they tried too, but unfortunately, it wasn't the experience I'm used to from Philly. The meat wasn't browned enough. The roll was somehow too soft, which is weird because they use the same Amoroso rolls that are used in Philly. And then the whiz.... they poured it on top of the meat. Travesty, I tell you. In Philly, they mix it in with the meat so that you have an equal bite of cheese to meat. I honestly didn't think it'd make much of a difference, but i had a ton of cheese in the bites I took from the top of the sandwich, and no cheese on the bottom of the sandwich. 

They did have tastykakes though. That made me pretty happy. I also like how they're open 24 hours a day. I'll have to try one of their breakfast hoagies (incorrectly named by Pops as "Breakfast Phillys".... honestly, if you go into a sandwich shop in philly and ask for anything called  "philly", they will not know what you're talking about).

So why the three star review if I was dissatisfied? Well, I hate giving low reviews to perfectly good businesses. I'm sure what I ate was a great sandwich. For people from Vegas who want a good cheesesteak, this is a great option. For people from Philly who've had the real deal however, you may be a little disappointed that it doesn't taste like it's from back home.

Thisi is the best cheesteak place EVER! We see him set up shop every year at san genero as well and with all that other food around still end up buying from him!!!! #1 They have cheese whiz which alotta places dont Yumm the steak is always tender perfectly cooked. I have had almost every combination of sandwhich possible. They are just number one for me and my fiance, he proposed  on our 2nd anniversary there we go every year  for our little memorable meal together!!!!! Sweet potato frys are delicious we always get a double order of the mushrooms and the zuchinni is good as well. Definately a place to go if you want a really good cheese steak!!!!   O yea they have tasty cakes!!!!!!!!yummmmm!

Great cheesesteaks and cheez whiz fries! Busy but worth the wait! You can make sure they get your order right because they make it right in front of you too. It's open 24 hours, so very convenient for great food anytime. Cheese fries are awesome and certainly don't lack on cheese. The meat is not fatty at all, and seasoned perfectly. Mozzarella sticks are also awesome and they have homemade ranch!

I grew up in L.A. County, so there is an overwhelming amount of hole-in-the-walls/ mom n pop shops. Thats where my heart is. In summerlin, I don't see many of those but when I tried his place, I felt at home. Your typical sub sandwich and fried sides is quality worth every penny and brings comfort, and the food too. It's a walk-up shop with outdoor stool seating. The folks that work here are chill. Customers are able to watch the cooks do their thing. Seriously, they're diligent in making every sub just right. I've been here a few times and haven't had any disappointments. Try this place at least once.

This place is a 30 minute drive for us but well worth it. I knew the minute we drove into the parking lot that we hit the jackpot for a genuine PHILLY Steak with whiz and grilled onions. Bun super soft with a great taste which makes a the sandwich taste even better. Ordered a side of onion rings which had a buttery taste, very crisp and served with ranch dressing...Yumo! 
I'm already planning our next visit which will probably be next week. I think I will try PHILLY with grilled mushrooms/onions. They also serve Hoagies if your into that type of sandwich.
Pops make a good philly cheesteak but it would be alot better if he did not talk as much.  Pops doesnt look that innocent.  He looks like he been in a prison cell before.
The steaks were hot fresh and juicy. Your choice of cheese onions peppers and hot sauce. Next time I am trying the pork grinder. Good eating!

If you want a good (and I mean GREAT) cheesesteak in Vegas, pass up Pops and land yourself at one of the many Capriotti's. I've had a few Cap's sammies ($8 medium cheesesteaks with mushrooms and peppers) - amazing. Drove by Pop's mid-Saturday. Was starving so decided to try it out. $10 later, I was bummed. The shrooms were canned and tasted like it. Yuk. The meat was dry. I had the provelone on top, still not a moist sammy. Wished it had been a Capriotti's. One star for being 24-hrs.

I've been here once.  It's a very good sandwich, but a little too much meat.  The seating options there are very limited and can get very crowded at lunchtime.  I will return, but not during busy time of day.

This place is the real deal. Makes me want to move to Las Vegas. Nothing in Southern California comes close. If your visiting Las Vegas make the drive to this place it will safisfy your cravings for cheesesteaks.
Cheesesteaks are so fab here. Get the sweet potato fries with the sauce - oh!!!

Pop's make Philly Steaks like they do in Philly with Cheese Whiz!  I had a specific craving last week for a good Philly Cheese Steak sandwich so I Yelped and gladly found this place.

I like my Philly Steaks with provolone cheese and the works; mushrooms, onions, and peppers.  This place did not disappoint.  The steak in these sandwiches are thick, and pack ina lot of flavor.  I was actually able to finish the entire thing in one sitting.  I love the french fries too.  This place has one of the best Philly Steaks I have ever tried.  

The only downside was that it was scorching hot outside when we came here to eat and we were sweating while trying to enjoy our food.  They also serve Italian shaved ice here to cool you off but we didn't try it..  Good idea though.  The oustide atmoshere is pretty chill and a different way to enjoy the Vegas environment in the neighborhood in which the place resides. 

If you want a good, authentic Philly Steak sandwich, come to Pop's!

FOOD= :(
STAFF= Not friendly 
PRICE= For the crap you get too much


This is no big deal. Go to the grocery store buy all the stuff and make it at home. 10 X better plus the people who work their are rude.

Solid if you are in the mood for a pretty legit Philly Cheesesteak.  I would recommend splitting the sandwich and never tell your doctor about this great meal.  I had the philly with wiz, onions and peppers.  Friendly staff too.

I like Pop's for the middle of the night munchies.  

Steak with mushrooms and provolone is my usual, with a side of fries.

For some reason It's always really, really windy whenever I eat at Pop's.  I need to create an excel spreadsheet to find the correlation between barometric pressure and cheesesteak cravings.

Came out here for the weekend with my boyfriend we were starving and came across pops Philly's!!! Great service & great FOOODDD!!!!! very reasonable price! Daniel helped us out thanks again for your service you were great! Fersure we will be back , Our New Favorite hot spot :)) !!!

Once upon a time, this place was a Straight From Philly Steakout. (Then again, once upon a time it was a Weinerschnitzel & then it was a Weanie Bender, but that's beside the point. :-D ) When it turned into Pop's, I wanted it to be as good as Philly Steakout, which I miss terribly. They largely kept the same menu, after all. However it is not quite as good. 
Don't get me wrong, it's still pretty decent. I still come here from time to time. And of course, middle of the night dining options are always good. However, the phillys aren't quite as tasty as their predecessor's. It seems like maybe they really love oregano. A lot. Like, really a lot. That appears to be the main flavoring that they use to distinguish themselves from other philly joints. Chicken phillys are better, not so over seasoned. I really want to love the cheese fries, but at least when I go there in the evenings the old, old fries are just thrown back in the fryer for you. Now I know that some places double-fry their fries. However, if you double-fry really old fries, you just get nasty over cooked & over greased fries. It's a consistent thing here. Perhaps during the daytime I'd have better luck w/ the fries. 
Also, I've witnessed several times where people will go from money handling to directly touching food. Not a cool thing. Soo, yeah. Not terrible, but just ok.

This place is downright delicious.

I was craving cheese steaks as soon as I came back from philly and this place came recommended as one of the best in las vegas.  It's the only cheese steak establishment I've ever seen in sin city so I thought I'd give it a try and I'm sure glad I did.

It's just a really good cheese steak.  That's all there is to it.  The bread is soft but not too soft.  The steak is cooked just like it would be in Philly and the toppings are plentiful and tasty.  There's also many different variations to choose from like the cheese, peppers, onions, and what kind of sauces you want on it.  I always go steak 'wit' provolone, peppers and onions.  Writing this review right now makes me want one.  I guess I'll have to settle for Philly's Best tonight, but that's another review.

I think I could have had a better philly sandwich at Capriotti's, a place that isn't even known for their philly sandwiches. 

While I do like fast service, getting served already cooked meat, onions, and mushrooms swimming in meat juice and reheated on the grill isn't what I was hoping for. Three distinct flavors that should all be tasted in a good philly, and everything tasted like the meat juice. I asked for American cheese and I think I was given provolone, on account that it was especially stringy for whatever reason. There was so much bread in comparison to the meat, onion, and mushrooms that was in the sandwich. 

The frier was broke or being cleaned, so I couldn't get any fries or other side items to go with my sandwich.

I always hear positive praise for this place, but for all the years I have occasionally bought food here, I have yet to have a good meal here that would make me understand the hype.

Pretty far off the strip but definitely hits the spot after a night of drinking and clubbing.  They are also open 24 hours.  

Plenty of cheese steaks on the menu, made a variety of ways.  We tried the cheese whiz steak, provolone, american, the hoagie, 3 cheese and chili, the chicken steak, and the bbq pork grinder.  

I personally liked the bbq pork grinder the most.  The bbq sauce was addicting.  Then the 3 cheese and chili cheese steak since it had so much flavor.  About 10 dollars per cheese steak so not the cheapest you can find but definitely worth the trip out here and cost.

I would give this one star - except it's one of the few Philly Cheesesteak places in town.  Meat was dry and underseasoned.  Bread was decent.  Just no reason to ever go back.  

Don't know why you'd serve a sandwich with meat as dry as this.

This is "fast food "  Los Angeles style. I say L.A. because you see places like this
all over... but what sets this apart from most is the food. Nothing mediocre
about it. The sandwiches are huge (enough for 2) and very tasty. The Italian was
excellent and would have done A -1 Imports in Long Beach,Ca. Proud. You can
get "bananas foster". Deep fried string beans. I got this stuff home and opened the
bags -- my sweeties ' eyes damn near popped out - the food is great looking but
tastes even better than it looks -- that sandwich made me cry, for God's sake. I
honestly wiped tears from my eyes.

I do love going to this place and the quality of ingredients are good and are from Philadelphia.  I was there one day when the UPS guy showed up with the boxes of rolls from Amaroso's Bakery in Philadelphia.  My complaints are no indoor seating, which is a problem during the miserable Las Vegas Summers.  From May to September, you basically have to get it to go.  And it's not as good unless it's hot and fresh.  The person taking the order doesn't always get it right. Double check your orders before you leave.  And it is very pricey.  You'll pay over $15 for a sandwich, fries, and a drink.  But I guess you pay extra for the Philly imported ingredients.  The taste is good though and it is the best cheesesteak I've had outside of Philly.  I do like the fact that they are 24/7/365!

Pop's. Can't miss the lightup signs at this location. Well this place is crazy busy or dead. I recommend going there at graveyard shift since half price sandwiches. Anyways, the phillys are good with them being decent size with juicy flavor and lots of fillings. The best thing on the menu is the potato fries and the dipping sause for them. So flavorful and make you want to come back for more. They're kinda pricy for what they are (4+$ for fries) but they make the meal. It's worth your time for a quick philly grab. 

PS: no indoor seating, there's a roof cover but if it's cold, you'll freeze and if it's extremely hot, you'll roast.

I have driven by here so many times so when a technician of mine asked to meet there I was happy to do so.  The only down side is the price $30.00 for 2 and that is sandwich and drink for each plus a 1$ tip.
The food to me was great I have not had much experience with steak subs but it was very good I will go back again sometime
This place is AMAZING. They're always open and just have great tasting food. Defiantly one of my favorite places in Vegas.
Cheese steaks in multiple varrieties.  Not bad food but I thought it was a little pricey...a little over $11 for one cheese steak and a soda.

Pros- amoroso bread, size and franks soda.
Cons-  meat can be too salty, sometimes skimpy on the cheese and last visit out of black cherry soda.

The food is ok. The service is EXTREMELY SLOW!! The owners really should rethink how patrons are served one order at a time is very time consuming. Also i dont think the cashier should be handling food and money with no gloves! the cook should also be wearing gloves. very unsanitary!!

I really wanted to like this place. And I really wanted a pastrami sandwich.  God knows I was craving since lunchtime. So dinner time came and I decided to pick 2 up for the wife and me. Well, the pastrami sandwich was as dry as the vegas air. NO MUSTARD, NO PICKLES and just a hard bread that felt was a few weeks past its fresh date. On top of all that, they were cheap on the meat too, which often most pastrami places over stack or give a good sizeable amount.  40 dollars, 2 sandwiches and 2 fries later wife and I were left very disappointed,  will not come back and I will not recommend this place to anyone I know. Just trash. Pass. Pass pass.

Well ok food...poor pops they need to upgrade dinning area or at least clean it. I saw a yelp reviewer mention that they refried old fries when she ordered I thought that was probably not true. Well I watched them do the same thing with my order...omg I had a bad taste I. My mouth the rest of the evening. I ordered Philly steak sandwich wich was ok. I won't be back for a while. Also greasy sweaty guy sweating on top of the food he's making. Just gross.
Pastrami on a long roll, filled with Pastrami, grilled onions, pickles and mustard. Yes! Not the best but getting there.
I've never been to philly so I can't actually say I've had a real Philly cheesesteak however I will say this is the best philly I have tasted so far. And the cheese fries are good too.

Not that great. I've had cheesesteaks in Philly several times and this does not compare. Not to mention the steak was dry because it had been cooking and sitting there for who knows how long. It wasn't horrible by any means but I don't think this place was worth the hype. Maybe we just went on a bad day I don't know, I would try it one more time but as of right now I was not impressed. They do not offer any sort of kid friendly menu such as hotdogs or something like that that was a downside for us as well.

UPDATE:  after reading a message from someone at this establishment who was unhappy with my review, I likely WON'T give it a second try. Seriously, for you to say your demographic isn't children which is why you don't serve any kid friendly food is ridiculous! You are not a bar or a club, if you were I'd totally understand and would not have even mentioned lack of kids menu. This is a freakin sub shop... and FYI there are tons of families in the area and having a few simple items on the menu MIGHT boost your business!  Funny I saw high chairs at your restaurant ... WHY? you don't serve kid friendly food! Oh well.  Lesson learned.

They ship their bread in from Philly. It's real deal Amoroso rolls. Oh yeah, It's 24 hrs too. That's always a bonus. 

It's not a restaurant, so expect to take-out, or eat at a small picnic table (outdoors), There's no indoor seating. Minus one star for that.

It's an authentic cheese steak. You won't be dissapointed!!!

Pop's has been there for some time and while it looks it, don't let it scare you. Locals know they make a great authentic Philly Cheese steak. Some may think $9.99 is pricey but it's not for the size, amount of fillings and the flavor. They make it right in front of you and they have an awesome menu of variations and sides. It's patio dining which works best for evening and overnight dining. They do not have a drive thru but service is very fast. This location is 24 hrs which is a blessing for late night runs; I'm glad I moved back to this side of town. With their Philly's and wings, they have seriously changed my Sunday morning Football plans... I can dine in at home!

I just picked up a prov. cheese and a prov. mushroom cheese. eeeh I totally had better. I don't agree with the review on cap and pops. I still think Cap. has better meat ratio cause my bun had so much room for more meat to be filled. And they said it exploded. NOT even close. 

So I came here with a groupon pretty stoked that i get to try it again. Haven't been here in years. Before it was good. But I'm gonna say. NAW I've had better. and that would be Giamela's in L.A. or in Philly. They know what's up. We also ordered the fried green beans (yum), friend cheese stick (good), and fried zucchini (not bad) I'm sure all of them are from a box right? who knows. 

The workers please smile. I know you love your job. Cause you have a job. The area was clean and the parking is cool. It was not crowded. So it was not busy.

this place has good food but horrible service, they do not write down the order, they do no repeat your order to make sure it is correct.  they make you wait in the heat till they are done with what they are doing. there very expensive for being fast food - they charge you for everything, they have no "meals" but they make you purchase the fries when you didn't ask for it...not fair that is why the place is empty, people will try it once and never go back!!!
Love this place!! Delicious food, quick and easy.  loved #9 and the onion rings were one of a kind!!

*sigh*  I really wanted to love this, but it was just ok.  After reading all the positive yelps and testimonials on Pop's website, I was expecting a fun and delicious experience.  I imagined myself giving my order to a gruff but charming grill master, who would ask me 'wit' onions? in an authentic Philly accent.  What I really got was a grill master who was just gruff and apparently couldn't hear my order, because when I got my cheese steak home, there were no onions on it at all!   

Ok, the cheese steak itself:  the meat was not fatty or greasy, but slightly bland.  I enjoyed the cheese whiz and the bread was very good.  I think if they had included the onions, things would have been tastier.  Also, in the hours since eating the steak, I have been a bit 'indisposed', but this in and of itself has never been an index of whether I would return to a place if the food tastes good.  (masochist!)

So all in all, I think I would try it again probably.  But I'll also try their competition in town and yelp the results.  :)

Go to Pops for the best Philly Cheese sandwich in Las Vegas. Pop's uses high quality beef and the freshest buns. A variety of toppings, onions, hot or sweet peppers and a selection of cheeses are available. 
Ordering and food pick up is done at the counter window. Only outdoor seating is available with a few tables under the covered patio.
Just OK.Use to be much better.Philly steak is unseasoned, however  I do like the pastrami fries. Over priced for not being one of the best tasting philly steak joints.

I love Pop's! The cheese whiz is what I order with extra whiz and provolone (yep it is cheeeeeeezzzy) and onion. I am never disappointed. 

I love that they have "wise" chips as well.

My husband can eat a whole sandwich and be satisfied I personally can only eat half then save the other half for later it is well worth the money. This last visit was nice because there was no line! Sometimes there is a line but it moves real quick. 

I recommend it to anybody that loves cheese steaks and all who think they don't.
It is on a old school original A-frame wiener schnitzel and if it is your first time you can drive through the middle of the "A" but don't think there is a drive-thru to order food it is simply a place to get you back on the road you must park in the lot and walk up to the window.

The "Mozzarella Sticks" and "Cheese Whiz Fries" are super yummy.

You can sign up for their e-club and get coupons and deals.

I have seen that they now have a food truck as well at a couple food truck events so give it a try!

I'mma give it a 5-star because the sandwich was pretty filling...the rest is subjective.  I prefer my philly steak sandwiches to have a garlic mayo, noticeable slices of onion and bell peppers and mushroom.
I got a #4 which is the steak with provolone cheese.  size was good and steak portion was great, so was the steak flavor.  I didn't see too many noticeable onions though since it was pre-sautéed and mixed in.  just the sandwich was $10.80 after tax.  meh, I'd say it was worth it.  I am not a fan of cheez whiz, which there seemed to be a lot of varieties of items using it, but at least it is Kraft brand.
Oh well, take it as you will.  I would recommend this place though.

the best Philly Cheese steak in LAS VEGAS. .My husband and I have been acouple of times always great service and great food..  it is small and outside dinning only but  it adds to the   feeling of being in Philly @ Pats or Ginos   there a wide variety and low prices love it

Solid 3 1/2 stars!

I suppose Pop's is a bit of an institution here in LV, probably one of the oldest places here where you can get a Philly cheese steak.  Hard to believe that I work less than 5 minutes away from here!  I can now come here whenever I want for some steak!

I probably would have given a 4 star if I had just stuck with their mantra...any of their famous steak sandwiches.  Possibly some fries.  We kinda did a detour by ordering things you wouldn't ordinarily get at a Philly cheese steak place so that took it down a notch.

Came here on a late night (probably the best times for one of these) and wouldn't you know, Pop's was hoppin'.  Parking lot was full!  We had no problem waiting in line though, goes pretty quick.  Wifey and I ordered:

*#4 - Provolone Cheese Steak ($9.99)
*#35 - Pork Bar-B-Que ($9.99)
*Fried Okra ($3.95)

But of course, best thing we had was the Provolone Cheese Steak!  Roll was light but still fresh tasting, there was a lot of meat & cheese in this sucker!  Oiliness galore!  Just like it probably should be.  Fat = FLAVOR!  Meat was seasoned well and was the focus of the sandwich.  Basically meat, cheese, bread.  Pretty damn delicious cheese steak.

Took away a star though for the rest of our order.  The Pork Bar-B-Que sandwich they said is an award winner but I just didn't like it that much.  The pork was overly stringy, but the sauce?  It was wayyyyy too sweet!  Like almost sickly sweet!  I was looking for more tang or bite to the sauce.  But the sweet was just too overpowering.  Really not on my want list.

The fried okra was OK, it was just really fried okra.  A little bland but fried fresh, could have used a bit more seasoning.  Plus it didn't really go well with our sandwiches so it was kind of forgettable.

Prices are fairly reasonable, but man paying nearly $10 for a sandwich gets to me for some reason - I guess it's because we have so much cheap food in town.  I mean come on, I can go downtown to get a prime rib dinner with sides, salad bar & dessert for the same price!  But thankfully Pop's cheese steak is tasty.

I'll be a regular at Pop's especially during my lunch days at work.  But I'll just go for a steak sandwich from now on!

#sweetmeat

I'm not sure how many stars to give this place.  I enjoyed the employees they were very pleasant but the food was very average.  Not the worst cheesesteaks I've ever had but in the bottom 5.  Not enough cheese or flavor.  At $10 it's way too expensive for extremely average food.

Not a real Philly Cheesesteak!
Went there with high expectations because any place that claims to have Philly Cheesesteak better know how to make a Philly Cheesesteak.  Not here.  Being a native Pennsylvanian and growing up on REAL Philly Cheesesteaks, this was a big disappointment.  Meat was not cooked to order on the grill, instead, probably cooked the night before( or worse) , put in a big pot and then simply re-heated on the grill when orders placed.  This process allows meat to sit in its own juice making the bread extra soggy.  So soggy that you can't pick up the sandwich with your hands.  He gives you a fork to eat it.  WHAT??  The meat had absolutely no flavor, very bland and chewy.  There is a reason that people stand in line in Philly to get a real sandwich and they don't mind the long wait because they know it will be the real deal.  Pulling meat out of a pot is not acceptable to call yourself a Philly Cheesesteak.  For all those leaving good reviews, well, I guess if you haven't had a real one, you just don't know any better.

this place has sandwiches that are overpriced and is drowned in cheese whiz. my husband I went here and we were so excited I cannot believe we paid $20 for two sandwiches we barely got any meat we really just got cheese whiz on bread. poor excuse for Philly cheese steak sandwich. we will never come here again if I could give it zero stars I would.

Came here around 5:45 and it was steadily busy. We ordered a #6 mushroom cheesesteak with cheese whiz and sweet potato fries. They were getting a bit busy and overwhelmed so customer service was okay. Food came out hot and fast! It was a fine experience, nothing crazy.

Was craving cheesesteaks ... Heard about pops ... Decided to try it out ... The line wasn't long kinda confusing were to order and watch people wanted to watch the cook and he couldn't take other people's orders ... Mind u he cooks and the lady serves u the food and drinks ..

I've been to philly lots of times love their cheesesteaks ... Pops was salty as heck ...

im born n raised in vegas, had a few different philly steak places out here and pops by far is tha best ive had. a lil pricy but when its prepared right, when the meat outweighs tha bun, tha flavors n juices of the marinated steak drench out from each bite, then tha price is worth it!!! 24 hrs, one of tha only spots in vegas that doesnt have a drive thru, its pretty classic. i always get tha chili cheese steak sandwich, hella good!!!

Got the chili cheese fries which were pretty darn good. Boyfriend and I got the provolone and steak sandwiches. The meat had no flavor and pretty much sucked. I'm thinking it would have tasted better with the cheese wiz because the cheese had yummy flavor to it. Definitely was on the pricey side for a sandwich.

Not bad at all. I love the cheese steaks from my favorite place in Rhode Island, but I will settle for Pop's. They did a great job seasoning the meat. Some places forget to season the meat. It's so good. Perfect amount of meat and cheese. The bread...absolutely yummy. I'll be coming back when I get a craving.

Yum-skiddley-umptious!

We ordered to go because it was too hot to sit in their outdoor seating.  Ate in the car.  The philly cheese steaks were great, cooked fresh, bread and meat all very tastey.  But the sweet potatoe fries were soggy and mostly just batter (might be the way they wrapped a paper around it, and steam was trapped).

Great for the phillys, not so much on the fries, and a downer for me to not have indoor air conditioned seating (we are in the desert people)

Excellent bread, excellent LEAN meat (I hate it when I get a disgusting piece of fat in there...none to be found at Pop's!), and the same traditional toppings as you'll find at Pat's or Geno's right in the city of brotherly love.
I love that there is no indoor seating (it's in an old Wienerschnitzel building) because it adds to the character and uniqueness of the place, which I am always on the look out for.
The sides are not the best or the cheapest, but hey, you came here for the sandwich.

ooooh myy goodness..  This is THE BEST Steak and Cheese my husband and I have ever had.. Seriously.. it's an off the strip joint that has high top tables and stools reminiscent of the the 50's .. you can hear and feel the whipping air of cars and tour buses flying down the street.. walk up to the window, order from a board and watch your scrumptious creation being made before your eyes.  Talk about Mouthgasm at first and Last bite.. I said to Michael.. $9.95 for a Steak and Cheese?  I hope it's good.. I couldn't finish Half of mine.. the meat was piled High and so tender and well seasoned.. I had mine with the original cheez whiz!   Michael, who considers himself to be a Steak and cheese snob.. couldn't stop raving.. and believe me.. it's well worth the trip.. top it off with Fries that were nom nom nommy and Root beer.. well it was a couple of happy New Las Vegans  lololol   Vegans in name only ~!!!

Forever curious about Pop's, the sun and moon aligned for me to give a shot during a recent lunch break.  Off course it was almost triple digits outside and the thought of eating in the swelter of the day was out of the question.  My order was pretty basic.  It consisted of steak, chez wiz, mushrooms and a pretty tasty bun.  It was a treat so I did not have to pay.  All in all, it was decent sandwich but nothing I would seek out during the dog days of August OR at 3:30AM on the corner of Decatur and Alta.

I've never been to Philly, but if their cheesesteaks are better than these... man, I need to book a flight. 

The food is good here. The cheesesteaks are filling, have a ton of food, and are perfectly complemented by their fries. 

My only issue with them as that I feel like I overpay a little there. I know it's good food, but it's a cheesesteak! I think I paid like $13 last time I was there for my food. It's obviously not a ton of money, but I don't feel the place/food matches the cost. 

Still, though, it's good food. And they prep it super quick.

Pop's is 'as good as it gets' when it comes to Philly cheesesteaks in Vegas. One of the main reasons I gave it 5 stars was because they use real whiz! It's underrated and great big portions for a reasonable price. The closest thing to a REAL Philly Cheesesteak that I've tasted in Vegas.

What the heck I thought food in Vegas was supposed to be dirt cheap. If you can get a steak and eggs meal for under $5 it puts Pop's $8-10 sandwichs into perspective. Sides are expensive too at $4 for an In-N-Out sized paper tray! =/

The did have variety on sides you can get cheez wheels, deep fried zucchini and deep fried okra. The side of sweet potato fries I ate wasn't bad at all, had good crunch (the number one thing I look for in a fry) and natural sweet potato flavor. The flavor was enhanced even further with this syrup dipping sauce that had a hint of cinnamon. =) 

I don't get how people can eat Cheez Whiz it's so processed it can't even be called cheese! I just didn't grow up with it, but apparently it's THE topping to get for Philly Cheesesteaks. You can even get a side of fries slathered with it here. 

This location was most likely converted from a Wienerschnitzel since it had the signature triangle roofline and drive-thru. The covered seating provided sheltered for our group when we experienced a spontaneous downpour during lunch.
